intro: Cotyledon umbilicus-veneris, commonly known as the "love plant," is a succulent species native to South Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, paddle-shaped leaves that are often adorned with distinctive markings. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family. Its leaves are capable of storing water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months.
